body.p:
To his Excellency
Gov. McGoffin
Dear Sir

The bearer Mr J. B. McGrath visits you for the purpose of asking Executive Clemency in his behalf= Mr McGrath like many a good & perhaps too indulgent a Father is forced to ask this of you on account of a son: who like many other boys, is very desirous of being considered a man & to accomplish all these points of course must -- Carry a pistol as one of the requisits -- his Father as is stated in the pition is a very "poor man -- yet as honest a man as lives in our midst & is only Enabled to support his family by diligently working at his trade -- & if I am any judge; I think this one of the Cases when the Commonwealth can with propriety -- yield up her interest & I am quite sure -- that should you find it compatable with your viws of proprity to remit the fine that it will be properly appreciated by your petitioner & also its numerous signers -- for the further corroboration of my statements I refer you our mutual friend Colo -- T. P. Porter --
